meanings.definition: The state or quality of being ambiverted.
meanings.sent1: Her ambiversion allowed her to enjoy both quiet nights in and lively parties with friends.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the ambiversion in her personality, as she can adapt to any social situation.
meanings.sent3: His ambiversion made him the perfect companion for any outing, always ready for fun or relaxation.
meanings.sent4: The ambiversion of the city was evident in its diverse nightlife, catering to both introverts and extroverts.
meanings.sent5: The ambiversion of the weather mirrored my indecisiveness, unsure whether to stay in or go out.

meanings.definition: A person who exhibits both introverted and extroverted tendencies.
meanings.sent1: As an ambiversion, she could enjoy a quiet book at home or a night out dancing with friends.
meanings.sent2: He embraced his ambiversion, finding balance between socializing and alone time.
meanings.sent3: The ambiversion at the party was the life of the gathering, mingling with everyone but also enjoying moments of solitude.
meanings.sent4: Her ambiversion was like a bridge between introverts and extroverts, connecting both worlds effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ambiversion of the cat was evident as it alternated between seeking attention and retreating for a nap.
